intro: Humata imrayana, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a strong, sweet fragrance. The plant has broad, heart-shaped leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Humata imrayana is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
